.
Definition:  Contempor-aneous Notice
A
contemporaneous notice
is a letter sent to a beneficiary at the same time his or her Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) benefits are reduced, suspended, or discontinued.  This notice is used in lieu of a notice of proposed adverse action and describes a completed award action, rather than a proposed one.
Example
:  The beneficiary provides written information adequate to form the basis of the adverse action.  The regional office reduces benefit payments and sends a contemporaneous notice informing the beneficiary of the reduction.
Reference
:  For a list of situations warranting contemporaneous notice, see
38 CFR 3.103(b)(3)
.
